item.description:
Put on your comfortable walking shoes and join us for a great day of exploring historical Plymouth on foot.

We're taking a leisurely walk along the waterfront path, to view the Mayflower, Plymouth Rock and the gorgeous waterfront. We'll continue on through Brewster Gardens, across town and visit the Jenney Grist Mill and check out Plymouth's oldest home - The 1650 Sparrow House.

After about 2 hours we'll end up back at the parking lot where we began to enjoy lunch by the water at the Lobster Hut menu offers something for everyone and for everyone's budget - from seafood to burgers, etc.

After lunch we'll go across the street to browse the unique shops at the Village Landing Market Place and indulge in homemade ice cream (voted the best in Plymouth) at Peaceful Meadows. 

You may also take time on your own to visit the historical sites such as the Pilgrim Hall Museum, tour the Mayflower Ship, or check out some of the old homes.

On the way into town (or out) be sure to stop off at the Forefathers Monument - it's a must see and it's free! Just follow the signs. Or meet the group there at 10:45 am.

The cost of this day trip is only $11.00 per person.

This fee helps cover the costs of the time and preparation that it takes to put something like this together and to lead the group for the day. I know you will find it worthwhile.

You will need money for parking and lunch.  Parking is $1.00 per hour and lunch ranges from $5-$17 depending on what you order).

Feel free to arrange carpools by using the comments section below.

Meet 10:45 am at the Forefathers Monument or at 11:00 am at the Lobster Hut parking lot. Directions will be sent to attendees in a seperate email.

Lunch will probably be around 1:00 pm.

There are public restrooms by the Mayflower

If it rains - we will postpone this event and you will get a full refund if you cannot make the rain date.
item.name: Plymouth Walk & Rock Day Trip
